channel.title: Find the inverse of this function
channel.description:
I'm stumped. Maybe it's just a slow moment for me.
Find the inverse of:
y=4x-(1/x)

item.title: Find the inverse of this function
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Not sure what you got, but I got:

y’ = [sqrt(x^2 + 16) + x]/[8sqrt(x^2 + 16)]

and

y’ = [sqrt(x^2 + 16) - x]/[8sqrt(x^2 + 16)]

Read full topic
item.source: Find the inverse of this function

item.title: Find the inverse of this function
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:5, topic:372706”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=468743.msg3427049#msg3427049 date=1292028824]
http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=inverse+of+y%3D4x-%281%2Fx%29

x(y) = 1/8 (y±sqrt(y^2+16))
[/quote]
Oops, I did get that result, just forgot to differentiate it; that’s why I wasn’t getting the correct answer. Silly me. Skipping a step.

Thanks Steve and David.

David, wanna differentiate it too?[/quote]
x(y) = 1/8 (y±sqrt(y^2+16)) differentiated = D[x[y] == (1/8) (y ± Sqrt[y^2 + 16]), y]

y=4x-(1/x) differentiated = y’(x) = (4 x^2+1)/x^2

Read full topic
item.source: Find the inverse of this function

Oops, I did get that result, just forgot to differentiate it; that’s why I wasn’t getting the correct answer. Silly me. Skipping a step.

Thanks Steve and David.

David, wanna differentiate it too?

Tbh I thought I was wrong lol

item.title: Find the inverse of this function
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

wolframalpha.com

Wolfram|Alpha: Making the world’s knowledge computable

Wolfram|Alpha brings expert-level knowledge and capabilities to the broadest possible range of people—spanning all professions and education levels.

x(y) = 1/8 (y±sqrt(y^2+16))

Read full topic
item.source: Find the inverse of this function

item.title: Find the inverse of this function
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

x = 4y-(1/y)
multiply by y
xy = 4y[sup]2[/sup]-1
subtract xy
0 = 4y[sup]2[/sup]-xy-1

Quadratic Formula
a = 4
b = -x
c = -1

y = (-(-x) ± sqrt(-x[sup]2[/sup] - (44-1)) / 2(4)
y[sup]-1[/sup] = (x ± sqrt(x[sup]2[/sup] + 16)) / 8

Read full topic
